column4: anyway I was here for a question myself, I have troubles starting gnome
what sort of problems?
it doesn't start right, even in failsafe mode the desktop, the panel nautilus nothings starts up
the only thing that starts up is tilda
if you have acces to a terminal, try reinstalling nautilus
tilda is like xterm
dunno what xterm is either,.,.;)
like gnome-terminal, a terminal
if you press alt+f2 you should get a dialog box xome up, and you can type a command in there and select the box that says run in terminal
alt+f2 doesn't work, if it wasn't for tilda i couldn't do a thing!!
alt-f2 is provided by gnome-panel isn't it?
do you have the GDM login screen? i seem to remember there being a way to switch to command line from there
i HAVE shell access, i even started xchat from my shell, that's not my problem
wait a min
in the shell,. type     sudo apt-get reinstall nautilus
i'll keep it in mind, but i'm almost sure its something else thanks
are you using compiz, try disabling it
tribaldata no compiz
tritium what really surprises me is that when i type gnome-panel things happens, not even a segfault message or something
tritium i mean nothing
im stumped then m8,. sorry,. i can only assume that its nautilus or GNOME itself, but i dont no if you can reinstall GNOME
thanks
thats because the only thing that is broken is your graphical interface,. the hard coding is still working
